meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by the use of symbols.
meanings.sent1: The painting had a symbolistic style, with hidden meanings in every color and shape.
meanings.sent2: Her symbolistic interpretation of the poem added depth to its overall meaning.
meanings.sent3: The symbolistic approach to solving the puzzle involved decoding the images instead of words.
meanings.sent4: His symbolistic view of the world turned everyday objects into profound metaphors.
meanings.sent5: The symbolistic nature of the ancient hieroglyphs fascinated the archaeologists.

meanings.definition: Representing something by means of symbols.
meanings.sent1: The logo of the company was a symbolistic representation of unity and strength.
meanings.sent2: In literature, a symbolistic can convey complex ideas in a single image.
meanings.sent3: The treasure map was a symbolistic puzzle that led to hidden riches.
meanings.sent4: The flag's colors had a symbolistic significance, representing peace and freedom.
meanings.sent5: The dreamcatcher was a symbolistic charm believed to protect from bad dreams.

meanings.sent1: The symbolistic language used in the play added layers of depth to the storyline.
meanings.sent2: The artist's symbolistic drawings were open to interpretation by the viewers.
meanings.sent3: The symbolistic signs on the trail guided hikers through the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her symbolistic gestures conveyed more than words ever could.
meanings.sent5: The symbolistic design of the logo captured the essence of the brand perfectly.
